cab.content: From Viceroy, Army Department, 13th May 1917.6999. In consequence of the Mahsud situation and as a precautionary measure in which we concur, the Coraraander-in-Chief has sent the following telegram to the Chief of Imperial General Staff: "In continuation of my No. 22,727 of 7th April. As the situation on the Frontier has become less favourable, I must for the present retain the seven Territorial Force battalions which are still due to Egypt."
